version.item: NF 4.X works under FAR 3 only. For FAR 2 please use NF 3.X.
All shortcuts are stored in sqlite now, Windows registry is not used anymore.
Both x86 and x64 versions of NF are used same shortcuts database.
Temporary shortucts work as general shorcuts. I.e. commands cd:+ и cd:: are equal.
If two NF panels are opened at the same time and you change data on one panel, then data on another panel is NOT updated automatically. Custom update is required.
Now, it's possible to execute known folders directly from command line using "cd:shell:abc" comman (abc - is known folder name).

From this version command cd: soft executes applications from separate thread. So, command returns control to FAR immediatelly, without waiting when finish of application launch. Catalog of the application is also opened in separate thread, so this operation doesn't hang FAR anymore.

Set of supported keys in variant menu in command cd: soft was changed. Now, Ctrl+Alt+Enter is used instead of Shift+Enter for opening application directory in FAR. There are two new key sequences here. Shift+Enter executes application without closing menu, Shift+Ctrl+Enter opens application directory in Explorer without closing menu.
cs: "word" didn't work without space after ":".

NF supports Known Folders under Vista/Windows 7. (see. http://www.sevenforums.com/tutorials/4941-shell-command.html). There are to variants of using known folders. Firsly, you can create alias for registy key $HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\\SOFTWARE\\Microsoft\\Windows\\CurrentVersion\\explorer\\FolderDescriptions The plugins "knows" this key and is able to read list of registered known directories from it. Such shortuct "shell" is add to standard file "StdPaths.reg". "shell" is replaced depricated "stdu" and "stda" under Vista/Win7. Secondly, you can set expressions "shell:abc" as shortcut values. Plugin recognizes command "shell:abc" as request to open known folder with name matched to "*abc*" (issue #55).
Now it's possible to edit catalog properties using F4.

Support of Windows 7 is implemented. Two new command parameters are introduced: "+lib" and "-lib". You can use it in such way: 1) cd::abc +lib - create shortcut abc for current directory + add current directory to exist win7-library. 2) cd:-abc -lib - remove shortcut abc and remove its directory from win7-libraries. 3) cd: +lib - add current directory to exist win7-library. 4) cd: -lib - remove current directory from win7-libraries. NF always suggest to select required Win7-library from list of exist libraries. Plugin uses libraries that are registered in Windows Explorer.

New flag in catalog properties: "Ask to add to default Win7 library automatically". If this flag turned on, then if you add new shortcut to catalog then plugin will suggest to add directory for this plugin to Win7-library even if "-lib" wasn't used.. And in opposite, if you remove shortcut from library, the plugin will suggest to remove it from win7-libraries even if "-lib" wasn't used.
New catalog property "Default Win7-library". This is library that should be shown first in the list of libraries when plugin suggest to user to select win7-library.
Pattern "cs: abc" allows to specify name abc in quotes and use spaces in abc, i.e. cs: "a b c"

New prefix "st:" to launch application through NF. This is first step for #29. Now, it's possible to launch applications in such way: "st:soft". Modificators ":" and "+" (i.e. "cd: :soft" and "cd: +soft") are NOT supported yet, we need different syntax here. Important: plugins registers two prefixes by default: "cd:" and "st:". If you install the plugin over previos versions, new prefix "st:" won't be added automatically, you need to specify it manually in settings.
New catalog attribute: "show in disk menu". If this flag is turned on AND flag "allow to show in disk menu" is turned on in plugin settings, then plugin will show this catalog in disk menu.
Flag "Show catalogs in disk menu" in the plugin configuration dialog is replaced by "Allow to show catalogs in disk menu" (issue #8).

New possibility to specify negative mask in paths. Negative mask is separated from positive one by character "|". I.e. command "cd:pf\*a*|*b*" will find all subdirectories of "pf" that are matched to "*a*" and, at the same time, not matched to "*b*".
New modificator for application launch command: "cd: +soft" automatically copies path to currently active file to clipboard, issue #52.

Command "cd: soft" allows to use quotes, i.e. 'cd: "soft"'. "Soft" can contain spaces. Spaces work as logical OR, i.e. command 'cd: "a b c"' shows applications which names match to "a" OR "b" OR" "c", issue #52
Не работали ярлыки, ссылающиеся ни на директории, а на файлы. Issue #49
Fixed issue #53 - there was a problem with jumping to root folder from subdirectory using command "cd:.\..\".
Mode "shotrcuts-values" in shorctucts variant menu didn't work.
Distance between columns in variants menu are made equal 2 spaces instead of 1 space.
Columns in variants menu were formatted incorrectly if item names were very long, issue #54
New view mode in variants menu for command "cd: soft": "application-directory", issue #54
View modes in variants menu are changed by F5-F9. Keys F1-F4 are reserved for other possible commands.

New possibility to sort results by selected column in variants menu. Use Ctrl+F5, Ctrl+F6 and Ctrl+F7 to select 1,2,3 columns, Ctrl+F12 - to display results unsorted. Selected column are displayed in variant menu in round brackets.
Performance of filter in variants menu is significantly improved.

New possibility to select NF in FAR dialogs. Open dialog, set cursor to edit box, enter command (with or without prefix "cd:"), press F11 and select Named Folders in the opened list of plugins. NF executes the command and returns result directory to the edit box. All "open" commands are supported beside "cd: soft". All commands for creation and deletion are ignored.
Minor code improvements.
Help is improved.

Plugin supports two new metacharacters "\**:N" and "\..*:N". They allow to limit deep search for search in deep and search up. Metacharacters "\**" and "\..*" are used for search with unlimited level search. If option "Short syntax in paths" is turned on, then you are able to use alternative variant for these metacharactes: N slashes and N+1 dots.
Command "cd:\\network_path" to open network paths directly doesn't work in previous versions of the plugin. Now it's implemented.
Pressing Esc during process of searching stopped search process without visualisation of already found results.
Plugin don't open aliases that links network directories with dot(s) in path, i.e. "\\computer\abc.cde"
Commands "cd:%var%" and "cd:%var" don't work under WinXP in some cases.
Command "cd:path" allows to specify path in quotes, i.e. cd:"c:\temp"

Commands cd:--f" and "cd:--df" supports new possibility to specify required directory directly, without alias. I.e. "cd:--f c:\temp\**". If required path contains spaces, the path should be qouted, i.e.: cd:--df "c:\program files\**:2\*diz"
Help is improved
Direct path commands use technology of search by related paths (see above). I.e. they support metachars "\**", "..*", "\*", "\..". Commands "cd:z:" and "cd:z:\" are executed as "cd:z:\*"
Command "cd:a/" created catalog. Now, it doesn't create catalog but only open exist catalog on NF-panel, see #38
Implicit commands of creation shortcuts for two directories (on both panels) are implemented: "cd:::", "cd::+", "cd:::catalog/", "cd::+catalog/", see #38
Command "cd::a/" didn't create catalog "a" if name of catalog contained only single letter, see #38

Pressing Ctrl+'/' on NF-panel resulted to creation garbage catalogs on panel, see #39. Now, Ctrl+'/' opens parent directory and set position on "..". Ctrl+PageUp opens parent directory and set position on previously selected catalog, see #41.

Implicit shorcut creation commands allow to specify catalog, i.e: cd::catalog1/. If "catalog1" doesn't exists the command will suggest to create catalog, not shorcut. So, to create shortcut with implicit name in new catalog "catalog1" you should execute command "cd::catalog1/" two times.
Command cd::a/b suggests to create "a", if "a" doesn't exist, and the suggests to create shortcut "b". Previously it did nothing if "a" didn't exist. See #20.
A lot of bugs were fixed.

group.title: Key changes
group.item: Plugin uses Far API 2.0 and unicode.
64-bit version of the plugin is released. Now plugin is available both for x86 and x64.

Plugin has own open source project on google code: http://code.google.com/p/namedfolders/. You can write bugreports and suggestion to issue tracker here. You can also download most recent snapshot of the plugin (all releases will be send to PlugRing as previously).
NF3 doesn't work correctly with russian shortcuts, that were created under NF2. As result, it's necessary to recreate all shortcuts, that contain Russian letters in names and/or in paths.

group.title: Changes
group.item: Launch of x64-apps from FAR x86 is fixed, see #6 (http://code.google.com/p/namedfolders/issues/detail?id=6)

Procedure of removing douple prefixes is changed. In previous versions NF, command "cD:ab:command" was equal to "cd:command" and command "cd:cd:cd:command" didn't work at all. Now, the plugin ignores all prefixes except last one. So, the command "ab:cd:ef:command" is equal to "ef:command".
Search in local paths is changed. No, the command "cd:alias.." can be written in more classic way "cd:alias\..". Both variants ".." and "\.." are supported to specify parent folder.
New possibility to edit shortuct from variants menu. F4 is used to edit menu. To change view mode "shorctuts and values" on plese use F7 instead of F4.

Macros FastPrefix is fixed for Far 2.0. Now, key ':' types "cd:" in command line and changes Russian to English if Russian layout was selected. So, you can press ':' and types your NF command in English langugage.
Variants menu shows total list of items.

Technology of search by related paths is completely changed. New metacharacters "\**" and "\..*" are used to search without deep limitations insted of depricatead metacharacters "\*\" and "\.\". Sequence of N-metacharacters "\*", "\.." is used to search on N levels instead of sequence of slashes and dishes. Old syntax with slashes and dishes are supported also (it can be turned on/off in plugin settings, see param "Short syntax in paths". See wiki page http://code.google.com/p/namedfolders/wiki/WIkiRelatedPathsRu for details.

If you execute command "cd:a\path" and plugin hasn't found directory matched to "path", it will show standard confirmation "do you want to go to nearest directory?". Previous version didn't show confirmation, they open the directory assigned to shortcut "a". You can disable this confirmations in plugin settings.

group.title: Settings
group.item: Possibility to specify fast key for the plugin in disk menu is removed. It's not actual anymore after releasing Far 2.0 build 1692. Issue #15
New flag "Show catalogs in disk menu". If it's turned on, then NF shows catalog in disk menu besid standard menu item "Named Folders". This is experimental implementation of Issue #8.
New flag "Short syntax in paths". This flag enables possibility to use "\\\" instead of "\*\*\*" and "...." instead of "\..\.." in related path. Also, it allows to use "cd:a.." instead of "cd:a\.."
